intro: Spigelia splendens, commonly known as the showy spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its nectar-rich blooms. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties, though it contains toxic compounds.
